Title:
Characterisation and neotypification of Gloeosporium kaki
Hori as Colletotrichum horii nom. nov.
Abstract:
A neotype is designated for the persimmon anthracnose
pathogen Gloeosporium kaki Hori and the fungus is transfered to
Colletotrichum as Colletotrichum horii nom. nov. Molecular and
morphological analyses place this species as a distinct group within the
Colletotrichum gloeosporioides sensu lato species complex. The fungus is
associated with dieback and canker of twigs and young branches of
persimmon, as well as spots on unripe fruit. The disease occurs on
persimmon in China, Japan, and Korea, and is reported for the first time
from New Zealand.
